88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (01:31): Has anyone reported big interoperability problems with IE9's stuff, either?  I imagine a major goal would be "get all the big canvas/video/etc. demos working flawlessly".
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:31): Well, it passes the CSS2.1 test suite better than anyone else, iirc.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (01:31): It looks to me like Microsoft has been doing a good job of standards support since IE8.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (01:31): Arguably since IE7, if you account for the fact that that was crippled by not throwing out IE6's engine and writing a CSS engine from scratch.

88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (01:32): 4d05dc3c4352ebe7593b536f2078cfe9, well, there are probably a lot more than 68 CSS2.1 bugs filed in either Mozilla's or WebKit's tracker.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:35): back when i was testing as a full-time job, most "lists of bugs" for browsers for which i knew the filed bug counts were off by a factor of 100 or more

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:47): anyone got any opinions on how WebSRT cues should parse if they don't have a valid timestamp?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:48): Drop on the floor?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:49): the whole cue up to the next double blank line?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:49): that's kinda what i figured should happen
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:49): other options are to just ignore the one line and try reading a timestamp from the next one
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:49): or to drop the whole file from there on
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:50): or to assume a timestamp of 0
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:50): or of equal to the last timestamp seen
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:51): I don't think anything that assumes a timestamp would be good.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:51): Dropping the whole file is no good either, if the rest is properly formatted.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:51): Ignoring just that line and trying the next sounds potentially cool.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:52): So, one of those two.  Either skip the line, or skip everything until the next double blank line.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:53): i guess skip the block is safest
